com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions.impl

Class DocumentSessionImpl<DocumentType extends Document>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions.impl.DocumentSessionImpl<DocumentType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DocumentType - The type of the provided document.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComparativeCheckCallback, CorrectionDialogCheckCallback, CorrectionDialogCheckSession, InlineCheckCallback, InlineCheckSession, PrepareRecheckCallback, RecheckSession, PrepareCheckCallback, TagListProvider, DocumentSessionControllerProvider, DocumentSession, MarkingStore

    public class DocumentSessionImpl<DocumentType extends Document>
extends Object
implements DocumentSession
    The DocumentSessionImpl is the default implementation of a DocumentSession. It provides common functionality and splits the rest of needed implementations to useful chunks.
    You could use GuiFactory.documentSessions() to create a new instance. If you have special needs you may inherit from this class directly. Implementing the whole DocumentSession could be also an option. In most cases this implementation should fit your requirements. If you are using an offset based document structure have a look at GuiFactory.markings().

    See: DocumentSessionComponentFactory and Extractor

        return factory.getStringDocument(yourTextBox.getText());
        Specified by:

      • removeMarkings

        public void removeMarkings()
        Description copied from interface: PrepareCheckCallback
        This method removes the markings from the document. This callback is called before PrepareCheckCallback.extractCheckInformation(AcrolinxFactory, ClientSettings, CheckCapabilities). Markings should be removed to not send any styling information belonging to the markings to the Acrolinx Server.
        If you only use the corrections dialog box this method does not have to do anything. Note: If you do an inline check you could use the InlineCheckDocumentSessionController.
        Specified by:
        removeMarkings in interface ComparativeCheckCallback
        Specified by:
        removeMarkings in interface PrepareCheckCallback

      • getKeyFromCursor

        public Key getKeyFromCursor(MarkingNavigator.Direction direction)

        Gets the key from cursor.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        direction - the direction
        Returns:
        This method should return the next or previous marking (depending on the given MarkingNavigator.Direction) near to the current cursor position.
        Note: You must implement a wrap around for the first and last marking in your document.

      • hideAndStoreMarkings

        public void hideAndStoreMarkings()
        Description copied from interface: MarkingStore
        This method hides all markings. It is called when the user clicks on the toggle markings button. It is only called if markings are present. You have to iterate over the text and store markings information.
        Note: You must also implement MarkingStore.restoreMarkings().
        Specified by:
        hideAndStoreMarkings in interface MarkingStore

      • restoreMarkings

        public void restoreMarkings()
        Description copied from interface: MarkingStore
        This method re-displays all markings. It is called if the user clicks on the toggle markings button a second time. It is only called if markings are present and only if MarkingStore.hideAndStoreMarkings() is called before. You have to iterate over the stored marking information and restore markings in text.
        Note: You must also implement MarkingStore.hideAndStoreMarkings().
        Specified by:
        restoreMarkings in interface MarkingStore

      • mark

        public void mark(Marking marking)
        Description copied from interface: InlineCheckCallback
        This method is called for each marking in your text. Please store the key (see parameter marking).
        Specified by:
        mark in interface InlineCheckCallback
        Parameters:
        marking - the marking Marking.getKey() of the marking in your application. All replacement and update logic will use the Marking.getKey(). One marking is mostly related to one issue in the text. The Acrolinx GUI SDK ensures that the markings will never be overlapping.

      • replaceTextAndRemoveMarking

        public void replaceTextAndRemoveMarking(Set<Key> keys,
                               String replacement)
        Description copied from interface: InlineCheckCallback
        This method is called when a suggestion is accepted by the user.
        Specified by:
        replaceTextAndRemoveMarking in interface InlineCheckCallback
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys of all markings that should be replaced. If this method is called with more than one key, you can remove all except one marking and replace this one marking with the replacement.
        replacement - the replacement text. The replacement may be empty (but not null) if a duplicate word is deleted.

      • reColor

        public void reColor(Key key,
           MarkingColor newMarkingColor,
           MarkingType markingType)
        Description copied from interface: InlineCheckCallback
        This method is called when your integration should change the color of a specific area of the text. It is called for example to mark the currently active marking.
        Note: The marking may move in your text by user input or accepted replacements. You must keep track of the position of a marking in your text.
        Specified by:
        reColor in interface InlineCheckCallback
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the marking
        newMarkingColor - the new color

        public void onEmbedCheckingStatus(CheckingStatus checkingStatus)
        Description copied from interface: InlineCheckCallback
        onEmbedCheckingStatus is called after onAfterMarking if AdvancedOptionsExtensionSettings.isEmbedCheckingStatus() This information can be used for off-line reviewing the checking status of a document by adding the status information to the document itself. Alternatively you can use the reporting database provided by the Acrolinx Core Server.

      • setGuiUpdateListener

        public void setGuiUpdateListener(GuiUpdateListener guiUpdateListener)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentSession
        Sets the GuiUpdateListener for the DocumentSession. Normally this will be done automatically by creation of GuiController via GuiFactory. In case you manage your DocumentSessions without DocumentSessionController and DocumentSessionControllerProvider you might have to call this method manually.
        Specified by:
        setGuiUpdateListener in interface DocumentSession
        Parameters:
        guiUpdateListener - The GuiUpdateListener which should be notified after a context menu command has finished.
